p: Probiotic growth stimulation of EPS was determined using the method described by Sawangwan et al. (2018) with modifications. Briefly, de Man, Rogosa and Sharpe (MRS) broth (10.0 ml) was prepared in different test tubes, sterilized at 121 °C for 15 min and was allowed to cool. The MRS broth was supplemented with sterile (0.22 μm milipore) 1% v/v of EPS, a negative control contained MRS broth, positive control contained MRS broth with 1% w/v of glucose or commercial prebiotic; fructose oligosaccharides (FOS). Each tube was inoculated with 100 μl of 10 6 colony forming units (CFU) L. delbrueckii and S. thermophiles. The tubes were incubated at 37 °C for 48 h under anaerobic conditions. After incubation, growth rate of probiotics was quantified by measuring their optical cell density using spectrophotometer at 620 nm. To determine load of L. delbrueckii and S. thermophiles, 100 μl was serially diluted in sterile distilled water up to 10 −4, where 100 μl was transferred to MRS agar plates. Petri dishes were incubated at 37 °C for 48 h. Thereafter, colonies of L. delbrueckii and S. thermophiles were counted using colony counter (TT-20, Techmel and Techmel, USA) and reported as colony forming unit per milliliter (CFU/ml).
